excerpt: Playa del Carmen is a coastal resort town in Mexico, along the Yucatán Peninsula's Riviera Maya strip of Caribbean shoreline. In the state of Quintana Roo, it’s known for its palm-lined beaches and coral reefs. Its Quinta Avenida pedestrian thoroughfare runs parallel to the beach, with blocks of shops, restaurants and nightspots ranging from laid-back bars to dance clubs.
detail_description: Playa del Carmen, located in Mexico's Riviera Maya, is a coastal resort town known for its palm-lined beaches and coral reefs. The Quinta Avenida pedestrian thoroughfare offers an array of shops, restaurants, and nightspots. This tropical paradise boasts breathtaking beaches and crystal-clear waters, making it a top destination for travelers worldwide. With 120 kilometers of shoreline in the Mexican Caribbean, Playa del Carmen provides access to cenotes and theme parks like Xcaret and Xelha.
name: Playa del Carmen
address: Quintana Roo, Mexico

excerpt: Jungle adventure park with zip-lining, amphibious vehicles, rafting & underground rivers.
detail_description: Xplor Park in Riviera Maya is a thrilling jungle adventure park offering a variety of adrenaline-pumping activities. The park is famous for its exhilarating zip line circuits, including the highest one in the area. In addition to zip-lining, visitors can enjoy boogie routes, underground river swimming, cave exploration, hamacuatizaje, and rafting through caves. The park also offers attractions like Mamita's Beach Club with stunning views and turquoise waters.
name: Xplor Park
address: Carretera Chetumal, Puerto Juarez Km 282, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Seaside park with sculptures, a kids' playground & traditional Mayan dance performances.
detail_description: Parque Los Fundadores, also known as Founding Fathers Park, is a vibrant seaside park in Playa del Carmen that serves as a meeting point for tourists and locals. The park features traditional Mayan dance performances and cultural shows every afternoon, showcasing the rich Mexican and Mayan heritage. It is home to the famous Mayan Portal, symbolizing the new cycle predicted by the Mayas in their calendar.
name: Parque Los Fundadores
address: Av Benito Juárez, Centro, 77713 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Coco Bongo is a renowned nightlife spot in Cancun that offers an extraordinary entertainment experience. It stands out with its unique fusion of Cirque du Soleil, concert, theater, and disco elements, ensuring an unforgettable night out. The venue features impressive musical performances by talented local artists impersonating famous celebrities, along with breathtaking acrobatics by trapeze artists and dancers.
name: Coco Bongo
address: Calle 12 Norte, esquina con Av. 10 Norte, Col. Centro, Gonzalo Guerrero, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: When exploring the underwater wonders of Playa del Carmen, don't miss out on Rio Secreto. This attraction offers a perfect blend of entertainment and learning, much like Xel-Ha and Xcaret. It's an experience that allows you to delve into the hidden secrets of underground rivers while enjoying an educational yet enjoyable adventure.
name: Rio secreto
address: Calle 38 Nte 152, Gonzalo Guerrero, 77720 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Quinta Avenida, also known as La Quinta, is the bustling main street of Playa del Carmen, stretching for 2 km and offering a vibrant mix of restaurants, bars, stores, and craft stalls. During the morning, it's a peaceful place perfect for a leisurely run or enjoying a cup of coffee while watching people pass by. As evening falls, the street comes alive with more visitors and lively street performers creating an exciting atmosphere.
name: Quinta Avenida
address: Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Trendy hangout for cocktails & international dishes, with beach loungers, evening DJ sets & a pool.
detail_description: Mamita's Beach Club is a popular spot in Playa del Carmen, known for its trendy atmosphere and variety of offerings. It's a great place to relax on the beach with a cocktail in hand while enjoying international dishes. The club provides beach loungers, evening DJ sets, and even has a pool for visitors to enjoy. It's recommended to reserve a chair with an umbrella to escape the intense Mexican sun while sipping on drinks throughout the day.
name: Mamita's Beach Club
address: Calle 28 Norte y la playa, Manzana 8 10, Lote, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Nestled at the northern end of Playa del Carmen, Playa Punta Esmeralda is a hidden gem that offers a tranquil escape from the more crowded beaches. This stunning stretch of sand features a unique cenote that flows directly into the Caribbean Sea, creating an enchanting blend of blue and green hues as freshwater mingles with saltwater. Ideal for families, the shallow waters provide a safe environment for little ones to splash around while adults can indulge in beach sports or simply relax on the soft white sands.
name: Playa Punta Esmeralda
address: Constructores 160, Nicte-ha, 77727 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: El Fogon is a popular restaurant in Playa del Carmen, known for its delicious food and friendly staff. It's not a fine dining establishment, but it offers generous portions of tasty Mexican dishes. Visitors recommend trying the nachos, chicken fajita, and sirloin los alambres. The nachos come with a bean sauce that can make the chips soggy, so it's best to eat them quickly. The pineapple juice is refreshing and doesn't contain added sugars.
name: El Fogon
address: P.º del Pedregal 1346-I, Galaxia del Carmen II, 77712 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Visitors can explore, swim & snorkel in these low-lit caverns with natural pools & stalactites.
detail_description: Cenote Chaak Tun is a hidden gem located just a few kilometers from Playa del Carmen. Unlike other crowded cenotes, this underwater cavern offers a more secluded and tranquil experience. With the help of a tour guide, visitors can explore the ancient cave, marvel at untouched cenote waters, and admire stunning rock formations with rich Mayan history. The cenote features two caves - one illuminated by artificial light for photography opportunities and showcasing impressive stalactites and stalagmites.
name: Cenote Chaak Tun
address: Av. Benito Juarez 7-km 4, Ejidal, 77723 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Palm-lined beach backed by upscale resorts, known for its fine sand, clear water & sunset views.
detail_description: Playacar Beach is a serene and picturesque destination located in the exclusive gated community of Playacar. It stands out for its tranquil atmosphere, soft white sands, clear turquoise waters, and swaying palm trees. Unlike other bustling beaches near Quinta Avenida, Playacar Beach offers a quieter escape with fewer crowds. The beach is lined with upscale resorts and private villas that provide various amenities for visitors to enjoy.
name: Playacar Beach
address: Quintana Roo, Mexico

excerpt: Hiking & swimming excursions along a turquoise underground river with stalactites & stalagmites.
detail_description: Río Secreto offers an adventurous experience for nature enthusiasts. Visitors can embark on a journey through the underground river, marveling at the stunning stalactites and stalagmites while hiking and swimming in the turquoise waters. The excursion begins with a bike ride through the lush jungle, followed by a captivating hike through caverns adorned with bats and rock formations. With knowledgeable guides leading the way, visitors can rappel into the fresh water to explore this hidden subterranean world.
name: Río Secreto
address: Carretera Federal Libre Chetumal - Puerto Juárez Km 283.5, Ejido Sur, 77712, 77712 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: The Playacar area is known for its upmarket residential villas, all-inclusive resorts, and luxury golf club. The clear waters and white sand of its namesake beach draw a mix of locals and visitors for kitesurfing, snorkeling, swimming, and sunbathing. Iguanas scamper over the Xaman-Ha ruins, a cluster of crumbling stone buildings used by the Maya until the 16th century.
detail_description: Playacar is a luxurious area known for its upscale residential villas, all-inclusive resorts, and prestigious golf club. The stunning Playacar beach attracts both locals and tourists with its crystal-clear waters and powdery white sand, offering opportunities for kitesurfing, snorkeling, swimming, and sunbathing. Additionally, visitors can explore the Xaman-Ha ruins where iguanas roam among ancient Maya stone structures dating back to the 16th century.
name: Playacar
address: Playa del Carmen, Quintana Roo, Mexico

excerpt: Contemporary Mexican restaurant in a vast underground cave with colorful lighting & live bats.
detail_description: Alux Restaurant Bar and Lounge in Playa del Carmen, Mexico offers a unique dining experience set within a vast underground cave. The restaurant's name pays homage to the Maya legend of the alux, mischievous creatures believed to inhabit such spaces. Descending down a flight of stairs into this subterranean chamber feels like entering another world, with enchanting lighting, luxurious decor, and natural formations surrounding diners as they enjoy contemporary Mexican cuisine.
name: Alux Restaurant Bar and Lounge
address: Av Benito Juárez Mz 217 Lt2, Ejidal, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Relaxed beach bar offering all-day Mexican & American dining, plus live music every evening.
detail_description: Nestled in the lively heart of Playa del Carmen, Zenzi Beach Bar & Restaurant is a must-visit for anyone looking to unwind by the Caribbean Sea. This relaxed beach bar offers an all-day dining experience with a delightful mix of Mexican and American cuisine, served right on the golden sands. With tables set against stunning ocean views, patrons can savor delicious dishes like loaded nachos and fish and chips while enjoying refreshing cocktails or cold beers.
name: Zenzi Beach
address: y la Playa, C. 10 Nte. 018, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: La Quinta Avenida in Playa del Carmen is a vibrant and bustling pedestrian street lined with cobbled stones, offering an eclectic mix of well-known brand stores, spas, restaurants, bars, pharmacies, and craft shops. This atmospheric avenue exudes a cosmopolitan and tropical vibe while maintaining an authentic Mexican charm. It's a top attraction in the town, located just one block from the golden shores.
name: La Quinta Avenida
address: Quinta Avenida, Gonzalo Guerrero, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Playa Mamitas in Playa del Carmen is a top destination for beach lovers. With its clear waters, white sand, and swaying palm trees, it's the epitome of a Caribbean paradise. However, visitors should be cautious with their belongings as theft can occur. Despite this, many enjoy the beach's vibrant atmosphere with music and delicious food options. It's recommended to visit later in the day to avoid large crowds and catch a stunning sunset.
name: Playa Mamitas
address: Calle 28 Nte MZ.10-LT.8, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Lively beach restaurant with a lengthy cocktail menu, serving tacos, burgers & seafood plates.
detail_description: Lido Beach Club Restaurant is a vibrant beachfront spot in Playa del Carmen, offering an extensive cocktail menu and a variety of dishes including tacos, burgers, and seafood. It's a popular hangout with live music performances most afternoons, creating the perfect setting to bask in the sun and enjoy refreshing drinks. The atmosphere is described as tropical and charming, with beachfront seating adding to its appeal. This beach club is highly regarded by locals for its tasty food and fantastic service.
name: Lido | Cocina de Playa
address: Av. 1era. Norte Bis, Mz. 22, Lote 3, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Trendy bakery offering French bread, pastries & standard breakfast items, with a buzzing vibe.
detail_description: Chez Céline is a trendy bakery located on Playa del Carmen's Quinta Avenida, offering a buzzing vibe and exquisite French culinary delights. This artisanal coffee shop is known for its delicious French pastries, bread, and standard breakfast items. The café provides a charming and warm atmosphere, making it the perfect place to enjoy an authentic French experience.
name: Chez Céline
address: Av 5ta Calle 34 Norte Esquina, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Patrons can take photos with 3D conceptual paintings at this interactive museum with many galleries.
detail_description: The 3D Museum of Wonders, located on the lively 5th Avenue in Playa del Carmen, is a unique and interactive museum featuring over 60 three-dimensional illusions. Visitors can take part in the art by posing for photos that create optical illusions such as riding a surfboard or interacting with historic scenes. The museum's paintings cover entire rooms from floor to ceiling, offering an immersive experience for all ages.
name: 3D Museum of Wonders
address: 10 Avenida Nte., Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: All-day dining spot popular for brunch, with a junglelike terrace plus vegan & vegetarian menus.
detail_description: La Cueva del Chango is a popular all-day dining spot known for its delicious traditional Mexican breakfast, including platano con crema, chilaquiles, and huevos rancheros. The restaurant offers a jungle-like terrace with abundant vegetation and tropical trees, creating a relaxing atmosphere surrounded by ferns and a gurgling creek. In addition to breakfast, the restaurant serves natural Mexican food for lunch and dinner, along with handcrafted cocktails and fresh fruit juices.
name: La Cueva del Chango
address: Calle 38 Nte Mz. 4-Lote 3, Zazil-ha, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Cenote Azul is a popular destination located around 20 minutes from Playa del Carmen. It features a large open cenote with crystal clear water, perfect for swimming and cooling off. The entrance fee is 150 pesos per person, and it's easily accessible by taxi from Playa del Carmen. Families staying in the area will find plenty of kid-friendly cenotes nearby, such as Gran Cenote, Cenote Cristalino, and Chaak Tun.
name: Cenote Azul Tours & Travel
address: 20 Avenida Nte., Centro, 77713 Playa del Carmen, Yuc, Mexico

detail_description: Playa del Carmen, located in the Riviera Maya, is a popular destination known for its stunning beaches and vibrant atmosphere. The area offers a mix of luxury resorts and trendy beach clubs where visitors can soak up the sun and enjoy the sea views. In addition to its beautiful coastline, Playa del Carmen boasts a bustling town center with an array of dining, shopping, and nightlife options.
name: Playa del Carmen
address: Mexico

detail_description: If you're looking for an unforgettable experience in the Yucatan Peninsula, consider joining one of the many 'Swim with Whale Sharks Mexico Tours.' Just a short boat trip from Cancun, you can fulfill your dream of swimming alongside these gentle giants. From May to September, the waters off the northern Yucatan peninsula become home to hundreds of whale sharks, offering a unique opportunity to witness and interact with the world's largest fish.
name: SWIM WITH WHALE SHARKS MEXICO TOURS
address: Calle 25 Nte., Hollywood, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Boardsports Beach - Kiteboarding & Paddleboarding School is a great spot to learn kiteboarding. The 3-hour lesson option comes with a fantastic instructor and plenty of equipment options. The beach provides an ideal setting for learning, especially on days with light wind. From putting on the gear to flying the kite and practicing various exercises, the experience is as fast-paced as you can handle.
name: Boardsports Beach - Kiteboarding & Paddleboarding School
address: México 307 Km 294, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: The Parroquia de Nuestra Señora del Carmen, a charming Catholic church near the renowned 5th Avenue, is admired for its striking architecture and design. Its pristine white exteriors and entrance with three bells lead to a main altar adorned with a unique tropical motif. The interior features minimal seating, a beautiful vaulted ceiling, and paintings on the side walls.
name: Parroquia de Nuestra Señora del Carmen
address: Calle 12 Norte y Calle 12 Norte Bis s/n, 15 Av. Nte, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Nature trails around ponds & forest enclosures, home to tropical birds like macaws & flamingoes.
detail_description: Xaman-Ha Aviary, located near the beach at Playacar Resort in Playa del Carmen, is a paradise for bird enthusiasts. Spanning 1.8 hectares of jungle territory, this sanctuary is home to over 60 different species of local birds living in their natural habitat without cages. Visitors can stroll along nature trails around ponds and forest enclosures to observe tropical birds like macaws and flamingoes flying and swimming freely.
name: Xaman - Ha Aviary
address: P.º Xaman - Ha, Galaxia del Carmen II, 77717 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Traditional dishes & drinks are served in this lively eatery that has a thatched roof & pavilions.
detail_description: Located at the end of Fifth Avenue in Playa del Carmen, La Perla Pixan Cuisine & La Carboneria is a vibrant eatery that offers a blend of traditional and innovative Mayan cuisine. The restaurant's rustic setting features a palapa thatched roof and the aroma of copal incense, creating an authentic Mexican ambiance.
name: La Perla Pixan Cuisine & La Carboneria
address: Calle 38 Norte Entre 5ta y la playa, Gonzalo Guerrero, 77720 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Over 50 ft. high, this arched beachside sculpture depicts men & women in a swirl of water & wind.
detail_description: Portal Maya is a striking 50-foot high sculpture located at Parque Los Fundadores, depicting two figures being pushed by a spiral of wind and water. Created in 2012 to mark the end of the Mayan Calendar, it celebrates the Mayan communities in the Yucatan Peninsula. Designed by Arturo Tavarez, it represents the new Mayan era and inaugurates a new tourist and historical era for Playa del Carmen.
name: Portal Maya
address: Av Benito Juárez 251, Centro, 77713 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Experience the excitement of a jungle buggy excursion in the lush forests of Playa del Carmen with the Jungle Buggy Adventure. Explore the unpaved country roads and discover a hidden cenote for a refreshing dip. Additionally, you can venture into an underground river section. If you're planning your honeymoon in PDC and Cozumel, don't miss out on this thrilling activity along with visiting Xel-Ha, exploring cenotes, shopping on 5th Ave.
name: Jungle Buggy Tour
address: Av. Benito Juarez, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Los Aguachiles is a popular seafood taqueria in Playa known for its innovative take on tacos, featuring options like sauteed shrimp and fish ceviche. The restaurant offers a relaxed atmosphere away from the bustling 5th Avenue. Guests can savor delightful tostadas topped with various ingredients and choose from an array of taco options, including octopus and shrimp or steamed fish with cheese.
name: Los Aguachiles
address: Av. Constituyentes Manzana 63-Lote 3, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Porfirio's Playa del Carmen is a stylish and lively restaurant located just a block away from the beach on the famous 5th avenue. The elegant open-sided salon with wicker chairs and hardwood tables sets the scene for an upmarket contemporary Mexican dining experience, complete with serenading mariachis. The extensive menu features both traditional and innovative Mexican cuisine, including favorites like tacos de canasta and molcajete mar y tierra.
name: Porfirio's Playa del Carmen | Restaurante de comida mexicana
address: 5ta Avenida, esq. Calle 12 Col, Calle 12 Nte, Centro, Gonzalo Guerrero, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Kool Beach Club is a popular beach club located between Coco Beach and the Cozumel ferry terminal in Playa del Carmen. It offers a welcoming and clean environment with attentive staff, lounge chairs, umbrellas, a swimming pool, international dishes and cocktails, and a DJ. Guests can enjoy the white sand beach and turquoise blue Caribbean Sea.
name: Kool Beach Club
address: Calle 28 y Zona Federal Marítima s/n, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: High-energy beachfront bar featuring live entertainment & music, plus an outdoor pool.
detail_description: Coralina Daylight Club is an exclusive beachfront bar and pool in Playa del Carmen, known for its high-energy atmosphere and live entertainment. It's a popular spot for adults looking to celebrate special occasions or simply enjoy a lively party by the turquoise Caribbean Sea. With stylish decor, wild pool parties, go-go dancers, and champagne blasters, Coralina offers a nightlife-type experience during the day.
name: Coralina Daylight Club
address: Calle 26 Nte S/N, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Martina Beach Club is a popular spot in Playa del Carmen, offering a fabulous daytime experience with live music, champagne processions, and stylish performers. Located at the end of Fifth Avenue near the beach, it provides an oasis away from the bustling city. This adult-oriented club offers a vibrant atmosphere for visitors to relax by the sea or pool. The professional staff ensures exclusive service so guests can enjoy delicious food and drinks without leaving their beach or poolside spots.
name: Martina Beach Club
address: Albatros, Zazil-ha, 77720 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Breezy restaurant/bar serving cocktails & pub grub in a colorful space with a beach-inspired vibe.
detail_description: Nestled a few blocks from the bustling beach of Playa del Carmen, Zitla Playa is a vibrant restaurant and bar that captures the essence of local charm. With its colorful murals and breezy atmosphere, it offers a delightful escape from the more touristy spots in town. The menu features an enticing array of casual eats, including succulent steak burritos, flavorful tacos, and impressive seafood towers.
name: Zitla Playa
address: Calle 12 Norte, Entre Av. 15 y 20, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Mandala Playa del Carmen is a renowned nightclub that's often the first place that comes to mind when discussing the city's nightlife. It's known for its upscale ambiance, where friends can gather, reserve a table, and enjoy music and dancing. While it may not have a large dance floor, it's a popular spot for socializing with friends. Visitors should expect lines to get in and are advised to arrive early or make reservations.
name: Mandala Playa del Carmen
address: 1 Avenida Nte., Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Axiote Cocina de México is a renowned upscale restaurant in Playa del Carmen, known for its gourmet Yucatecan Maya dishes and traditional Mexican favorites. The open-plan kitchen and airy palm-roofed al fresco dining area create a welcoming atmosphere for guests. The menu features locally sourced natural ingredients, offering innovative plates with atypical elements such as ant eggs, beef tongue, rabbit, and duck.
name: Axiote Cocina de México
address: Calle 34 Norte, #128, Lote 11-065, Gonzalo Guerrero, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

name: Aloha Paddle Club - Paddle Board & Surf Playa del Carmen
address: c/o Fusion Beach, Calle 6 Nte, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Simple dorms & private rooms in a lively hostel featuring free breakfast & a rooftop bar.
detail_description: Che Playa Hostel & Bar is a vibrant hostel located in the city center, offering simple dorms and private rooms. The reception desk operates 24/7, allowing for flexible check-in times. Guests can enjoy amenities such as air conditioning, WiFi, lockers, and a modern kitchen. The rooftop bar and chill area provide a great space to socialize with other travelers. This adults-only hostel is popular among Argentinian travelers and offers various activities for guests to enjoy.
name: Che Playa Hostel & Bar
address: Calle 6 Nte s/n, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Plaza Las Américas is one of the largest malls in Playa del Carmen, Mexico. It offers a variety of amenities including a movie theater, food court, grocery store, and department stores. The mall is popular among locals for weekend outings and social gatherings. While tourists often prefer shopping on Quinta Avenida, Plaza Las Américas provides an air-conditioned and modern indoor space with affordable dining options in its food courts.
name: Centro Comercial Las Americas
address: Plaza las americas, 77723 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Calle 38 Nte is a popular neighborhood known for its mix of luxury shops, souvenir stores, and quaint eateries. The area boasts charming open-air bars and restaurants like La Cueva del Chango, offering natural Mexican cuisine in a cave-like atmosphere; Piola, serving up delicious pizzas and pastas; and Trujillos, an inviting spot with wood tables and ambient outdoor bar.
name: Calle 38 Nte
address: Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Art concept Le Lotus Rouge is a unique and creative hangout in the city, offering an immersive art experience with spectacularly decorated rooms. The cabaret-style stage hosts various live performances, from traditional Mexican music to LGBTQ+ art festivals. The venue exudes an artistic atmosphere where art and theater converge in a distinctive and imaginative space. With its charming decorations and diverse entertainment options, including open mic nights and live shows, it provides a vibrant and lively experience for visitors.
name: Art concept Le Lotus Rouge is closed.
address: 35 Avenida Calle 2 Nte, Av Benito Juárez, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

name: Marquesitas del Marqués
address: Av. Constituyentes 54, Gonzalo Guerrero, 77720 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: El Cielo, meaning "heaven" in Spanish, is a stunning snorkeling spot in Cozumel, along with Palancar Reef and Columbia Reef. It's located about 8 km from the center and offers a clean and tranquil environment for visitors. The area is surrounded by lush vegetation and is close to the sea, making it an ideal place for permanent residence or relaxation. The accommodations are spacious with a contemporary vibe, providing a peaceful retreat amidst nature.
name: El Cielo
address: Amanecer, 77727 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: Elotes y postres "Los sabrositos playa" is a local street food spot known for its delicious grilled corn topped with mayonnaise and cayenne pepper paste. Visitors highly recommend the strawberries and cream, which are described as delicious. The service is praised as very good and fast, with Miss Jessica standing out for her excellent service. The menu offers a variety of tasty snacks at good prices, making it a great place to enjoy some delicious treats in a convenient location.
name: Elotes y postres Los sabrositos playa
address: Halcones, C. Avocetas Esquina, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Waterfront eco-archaeological park offering attractions such as snorkeling & cave exploration.
detail_description: Xcaret Park is a waterfront eco-archaeological park in the Mexican Caribbean, offering over 50 attractions suitable for all ages. It's an ideal place to immerse yourself in the region's natural beauty and cultural heritage with your family. The park features underground rivers, jungle exploration, and access to the Caribbean Sea. Visitors can also explore ancient Mayan ruins and experience Mexican cuisine and folklore.
name: Xcaret Park
address: Carretera Chetúmal Puerto Juárez Kilómetro 282, Solidaridad, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Compact venue featuring interactive exhibits, sculptures & collages of Kahlo reproductions.
detail_description: Museo Frida Kahlo Playa Del Carmen is a compact venue located on Fifth Avenue, offering interactive exhibits, sculptures, and collages of reproductions of Frida Kahlo's works. The museum provides a unique insight into the life and loves of the surrealist painter through guided tours. It is a popular attraction in Playa del Carmen, showcasing the life and influence of the iconic Mexican artist.
name: Museo Frida Kahlo Playa Del Carmen
address: Calle 8 entre 5ta Avenida y el Mar, Centro, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

excerpt: Enclosed mall with varied stores & a colorfully painted interior lined with faux palm trees.
detail_description: Centro Maya is a vibrant enclosed mall in Playa del Carmen, featuring a diverse range of stores and a colorful interior adorned with faux palm trees. The mall is conveniently located near the bridges, making it easily accessible for residents and visitors alike. It houses popular retailers such as Sam's Club, City Club, Soriana supermarket, and a movie theater. Centro Maya also offers pet-friendly services and establishments, making it a favorite destination for pet owners.
name: CENTRO MAYA
address: Carr. Cancún - Tulum 2100, 77712 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico

detail_description: The Cirque du Soleil Theater in Vidanta Riviera Maya, located near Playa del Carmen, offers a complete menu featuring 25 Mexican dishes and drinks. Visitors can enjoy a magical experience with exceptional service and delicious food. The show is described as intimate and captivating, with performances in both Spanish and English. Guests have the option to choose from appetizers or premium seats, with servers available for drink orders before the show begins.
name: Cirque du Soleil | Vidanta Riviera Maya
address: Carretera Federal, Cancun - Chetumal Km 48, 77710 Playa del Carmen, Q.R., Mexico
